Definition at line 207 of file bhm.h.

#define BHM_ETHERNET_OPEN_AUTO_FORMALS
Value:
{ .name = "tapDevice",          .type = ppm_PT_STRING, .description = "The name of the TAP device" }, \
    { .name = "redir",              .type = ppm_PT_STRING, .description = "Redirection instruction" }, \
    { .name = "tftpPrefix",         .type = ppm_PT_STRING, .description = "Path to the root of the tftp directory" }

Include this macro in the model's formal parameter list to declare the formal parameters used by bhmEthernetOpenAuto() in igen.exe TCL, use: imodeladdformalmacro -name BHM_ETHERNET_OPEN_AUTO_FORMALS

Value:
{ .name = "record",   .type = ppm_PT_STRING, .description = "Record external events into this file" }, \
    { .name = "replay",   .type = ppm_PT_STRING, .description = "Replay external events from this file" }

Definition at line 332 of file bhm.h.

#define BHM_SER_OPEN_AUTO_FORMALS
Value:
{ .name = "console",            .type = ppm_PT_BOOL,   .description = "If specified, port number is ignored, and a console pops up automatically" }, \
    { .name = "portnum",            .type = ppm_PT_UNS32,  .description = "If set, listen on this port. If set to zero, allocate a port from the pool and listen on that." }, \
    { .name = "infile",             .type = ppm_PT_STRING, .description = "Name of file to use for device source" }, \
    { .name = "outfile",            .type = ppm_PT_STRING, .description = "Name of file to write device output" }, \
    { .name = "portFile",           .type = ppm_PT_STRING, .description = "If portnum was specified as zero, write the port number to this file when it's known" }, \
    { .name = "log",                .type = ppm_PT_BOOL,   .description = "If specified, serial output will go to simulator log" }, \
    { .name = "finishOnDisconnect", .type = ppm_PT_BOOL,   .description = "If set, disconnecting the port will cause the simulation to finish" }

Include this macro in the model's formal parameter list to declare the formal parameters used by bhmSerOpenAuto() in igen.exe TCL, use: imodeladdformalmacro -name BHM_SER_OPEN_AUTO_FORMALS

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum bhmRestartReasonE
Enumerator:
BHM_RR_TRIGGERED 

restarted because event was triggered

BHM_RR_DELEVENT 

restarted because event was deleted

BHM_RR_BADEVENT 

failed to wait because event handle was bad

Definition at line 29 of file bhm.h.

enum bhmSaveRestoreStatusE

Used to describe status of save/restore operation.

SAVE/RESTORE INTERFACE

Enumerator:
BHM_SRS_ERROR 
BHM_SRS_OK 

error in save/restore restore

BHM_SRS_END_LIST 

successful operation

end of list (bhmSaveElement/bhmRestoreElement only)

Definition at line 324 of file bhm.h.

enum bhmSystemEventTypeE
Enumerator:
BHM_SE_START_OF_SIMULATION 

triggers at start of simulation

BHM_SE_END_OF_SIMULATION 

triggers at end of simulation

BHM_SE_LAST 

Do not use, keep this last

bhmThreadHandle bhmCreateThread ( bhmCBThreadFunc  cb,
void *  user,
const char *  name,
void *  sp 
)

Create a new thread. The processor will execute the callback function 'cb', which is passed 'user' as an argument.

Parameters:
cb Callback function which implements the thread.
user Passed back to the user function 'cb'
name The name used to identify the thread in the debugger.
sp Pointer to the region to be used a s stack. The user is responsible for getting the end of the region correct.
Returns:
Handle to new thread or null.
Bool bhmDeleteEvent ( bhmEventHandle  handle  ) 

Delete an event handle, restarting all threads waiting on it.

Parameters:
handle Handle to event to delete.
Returns:
success/failure.
Bool bhmDeleteThread ( bhmThreadHandle  h  ) 

Kill a process created by bhmCreateThread.

Parameters:
h Handle of thread to be killed.
Returns:
Bool return True if 'another' thread was killed.

double bhmGetCurrentTime ( void   ) 

Get the current simulated time

Returns:

Uns32 Uns32 bhmGetDiagnosticLevel ( void   ) 

Deprecated. Please use bhmInstallDiagCB.

Return current diagnostic level

Returns:
diagnostic level bits 0&1: 0=off 1=low (start-up, mode-change etc) 2=medium (each operation) 3=high Most detailed. This also turns on system diagnostics which shows activity on events, registers and ports. bits 2-31: reserved
bhmEventHandle bhmGetSystemEvent ( bhmSystemEventType  eventType  ) 

Return a handle to a system event object

Returns:
handle to system event

Install a function to set the local diagnostic level This function supersedes bhmGetDiagnosticLevel()

Parameters:
cb the callback function

Uns32 bhmMessage ( const char *  severity,
const char *  prefix,
const char *  format,
  ... 
)

DEBUG/DIAGNOSTICS Send formatted text to the simulator output stream. The text is prefixed with the severity, the prefix code and the model instance name. Use this for user-level diagnostics.

Parameters:
severity "I"=Info "W"=Warning "E"=Error "F"=Fatal (aborts the simulator)
prefix a short code to identify this message. This makes the message easy to extract using text tools.
format printf format string (see gnu printf for details)
... this is a vararg function
Returns:
number of characters printed (note: capped at 1024).
Uns32 bhmPrintf ( const char *  format,
  ... 
)

Send formatted text to the simulator output stream

Parameters:
format printf format string (see gnu printf for details)
... this is a vararg function
Returns:
number of characters printed (note: capped at 1024). This sends output to the simulator log without any pre-pended data. Only use this to produce tables, xml or data of your own format.

Uns32  bytes,
const void *  data

void bhmRecordFinish ( void   ) 

close record file

Bool bhmRecordStart ( void   ) 

RECORD/REPLAY INTERFACE Use this interface to record external events which change the state a of a peripheral so that it can be replayed without external stimulus. Open a recording stream. Call this during startup. It returns True if recording is required.

Returns:
False:(no recording) True:(recording required).
Int32 bhmReplayEvent ( double *  time,
Uns32 *  type,
Uns32  maxBytes,
void *  data 
)

Read one event from the log

Parameters:
time pointer to time variable which will be updated with current time.
type pointer to application-specific type code which will be updated with record type.
maxBytes maximum number number of bytes of application data to to restore (can be zero).
data pointer to data block to fill with restored data.
Returns:
number of application data bytes in record, -1 if end-of-file.
void bhmReplayFinish ( void   ) 

close replay file

Bool bhmReplayStart ( void   ) 

Queries the platform to see if replay is required and if so, begins the session. Call this during startup. It returns True if replay is required.

Returns:
False:(no replay) True:(replay required).

void bhmSerClose ( Uns32  ch  ) 

Close the channel.

Parameters:
ch The channel to be closed. This will also flush log files.
Int32 bhmSerOpenAuto ( void   ) 

outfile string Name of file to write device output (can be used in addition to other modes).

Create a new serial channel, blocking the simulator until it its connected to an external program. Derive all the operating modes of the serial channel from model parameters instead of arguments. These are the parameters: console string If specified, port number is ignored, and a console pops up automatically. This source is the 1st priority input. portnum integer If set, listen on this port. If set to zero, allocate a port from the pool and listen on that. See portfile and console attributes below. This is the 2nd highest priority source. infile string Name of file to use for device source. This is the 3rd priority input. portFile string If portnum was specified as zero, write the port number to this file when it's known. log string If specified, serial output will go to simulator log in addition to other modes. finishondisconnect string If set, disconnecting the port will cause the simulation to finish.

Returns:
The channel number, (the simulator dies if this function fails).
Int32 bhmSerOpenBlocking ( Uns32 *  portp,
const char *  logfile,
const char *  sourcefile,
const char *  portfile,
Bool  verbose,
Bool  console,
Bool  finishOnDisconnect 
)

Create a new serial channel, blocking the simulator until it its connected to an external program

Parameters:
portp Pointer to integer port number. If null, sockets are not used. If pointing to zero, a port is allocated by the system and the value overwritten. If non-zero, the port number is used. Ignored if console is true, overrides parameter sourcefile
logfile A string specifying a file to record all serial device output. On a Unix system, use tail -f file to watch the device output.
sourcefile A file to use as source for the serial device. Note that this data will be read as fast as the model requests it. Ignored if console is true. Ignored if portp is non-null.
portfile Used in conjunction with portp. A file with this name is written when the portn number is known. Overridden by the console parameter.
verbose Send UART output to the simulator log
console Pop up a console window, and connect using a socket. Overrides the port and sourcefile parameters

The terminal program which runs in the console is $IMPERAS_HOME/bin/[architecture]/terminal.exe which is supplied with various Demo packages. The program can be overridden using the environment variable IMPERAS_TERMINAL_PROGRAM, e.g. export IMPERAS_TERMINAL_PROGRAM="/usr/bin/telnet %s %d" set IMPERAS_TERMINAL_PROGRAM = "C:\Program Files\Windows NT\hypertrm.exe" /t s:d (s and d are replaced by the system with host and port number)

Parameters:
finishOnDisconnect When the socket disconnects, finish the simulation.
Returns:
The channel number, or -1 if it fails

Parameters:
ch The channel number returned by serOpenBLocking
buffer Pointer to character buffer
length Number of characters in the buffer
Returns:
Actual number of characters written (might be zero if socket is not open)
Uns32 bhmStringAttribute ( const char *  attributeName,
char *  string,
Uns32  length 
)

ATTRIBUTE INTERFACE Fetch a string attribute for the current peripheral.

Parameters:
attributeName Name of attribute to be fetched.
string String to be updated with value.
length max length to be filled in.
Returns:
success(1)/failure(0)
Bool bhmTriggerAfter ( bhmEventHandle  h,
double  delay 
)

Trigger an event after the specified delay. This will restart any processes waiting in the event at that time. Note that if the event is already scheduled to be triggered at a future time, the new delay will replace the existing delay (i.e. the event will be rescheduled). TODO : need to be able to cancel event before the delay elapses.

Parameters:
h Handle to event to trigger.
delay Delay until trigger occurs.
Bool bhmTriggerEvent ( bhmEventHandle  h  ) 

Immediately trigger an event, restarting any threads waiting for it, This is NOT equivalent to bhmTriggerAfter(h, 0); because this happens without suspending.

Parameters:
h Handle to event to trigger.
Returns:
success/failure (if the handle is invalid).
Uns32 bhmUns64Attribute ( const char *  attributeName,
Uns64 *  ptr 
)

Fetch a 64-bit integer attribute for the current peripheral.

Parameters:
attributeName Name of attribute to be fetched.
ptr pointer to value to be updated.
Returns:
success(1)/failure(0)
Bool bhmWaitDelay ( double  delay  ) 

Delay current thread for the passed time

Parameters:
delay microseconds delay to wait .
Returns:
success/failure
bhmRestartReason bhmWaitEvent ( bhmEventHandle  handle  ) 

Stop the current thread until the event is triggered

Parameters:
handle Handle to the event to wait for.
Returns:
reason that the wait completed.
